comment_data.body: a new variable in there not be a good choice. tried use `redraw_cmdline` in there seems not works correctly . still use an exist global status variable will be accept I think
too much of a hack, better to just let existing cells be what they are.
this will make exist cell use new attr . otherwise new attr not take effect for exist cell..
hmm this will make terminal/buffer_spec failed, but if removed the message will doesn't have new attr color like `Red`
Won't this break for multiline messages, messages that start with `-`, and cmdline drawn from right to left?

maybe. i thought a new way .i will rewrite here after i wake up

comment_regular_data.body: Updated test looks good. Something weird is going on in the ` uchar (cc=gcc)` build causing the last cell of a filler line to be missed, likely some issue in underlying grid.c code..
seems like only on windows ? I don't have a windows env :thinking:
